info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 1:42PM MST until January 02 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected across mountain passes and on the plains Saturday. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph Saturday over mountain passes and on the Plains. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero tonight. * WHERE...Central and Southern Lewis and Clark County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM Saturday to 6 AM MST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility Saturday. The dangerously cold wind chills tonight could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
